website_summaries.verdict: Tall tower will hold plenty of items, and it's constructed in four nice wood finishes.
pros: Can hold up to 288 DVD cases, but it will work for multiple types of media
Media tower has a nice build quality, as it will hold up to 400 pounds of items
Entire unit spins to provide easy access to all of the shelves
Available in black, cherry, oak, or walnut wood finishes
Unit measures almost 6 feet high, yielding plenty of storage
cons: Difficult to assemble because of some quality control issues

customer_reviews.title: Overall Design Limits Storage Options
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Relatively easy to assemble 2. Looks attractive Cons: 1. Needs more shelf bracket holes. The company decided where they should be and this has reduced options of shelf placement. I store my DVDs alphabetically. Some shelves won't accept special over-size cases like metal ones due to the limited shelf bracket holes. A poor design in my opinion. 2. The left side of each shelf is partially hidden by the decorative wood piece. It's difficult if not impossible to see the title of the left most DVD on each shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Frank A. Terry Jr.

customer_reviews.title: A recommendation choice for a affordable, attractive sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: Received very quickly I wasn't sure about buying another wood product CD storage unit, the last one started coming apart, but this one surprised me and I am very pleased with my purchase. I purchased the oak finish one and it looks fantastic. It's strong and sturdy and the appearance is very attractive. I believe this one will last. Their customer service is eager to please. I highly recommend this product. Thank you!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Looks great. Easy to assemble with provided directions
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Easy to assemble with provided directions. Plenty of left over shelves when configured for DVD storage. Instructions state which middle hole to start at for "optimal DVD/VHS storage" but if you are storing DVDs only, don't follow that particular part of the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Will Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and efficient storage system
customer_reviews.text: The cabinet looks great, and the oak color matches my real oak furniture. I purchased it to hold DVDs exclusively. It took me and my son a little over 2 hours to assemble. The assembly instructions is a little confusing, but goes together fairly easy. I agree with statements in other reviews in that it needs additional holes drilled to evenly space shelves. We also found it necessary to install shelves before securing the top. With that said, once it is together it is sturdy and an efficient storage system.
customer_reviews.author: Arleen J.

customer_reviews.title: The color is just like the picture

customer_reviews.title: Like it; just ordered another one
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with this purchase. In fact, I just ordered another unit today. The unit is what I expected it to be-- it's a nice, warm oak. It was fairly easy to assemble. The instructions were fairly clear. (It's much easier to do it with a drill rather than just a screwdriver, though.) I put the unit on caster wheels after I had assembled it. It would have been easier to attach the wheels before I started building the unit, so next time, I'm going to put the wheels on first. Overall, I'd rate it a 4 on a scale of 1 to 5.
